name: Andy-Machine-Portrait-2020
description: Oliver Roeder cites Andy Warhol as the most notable artist whose work acted in similar ways to crypto art. Warhol openly proclaimed his affinity for commercial success and making money, looking to promote his art and brand to the widest audience possible. Crypto art does of course evoke this model, melding currency with art creation, and there is a lot that could be written about the relationship between pop art and crypto art --- This artwork is made with in Processing. It exists also in Augmented Reality: install the Artivive app (artivive.com) and hold your smart phone in front of the artwork.
collection_description: SuperRare makes it easy to create, sell, and collect rare digital art. SuperRare's smart contract platform allows artists to release limited-edition digital artwork tracked on the blockchain, making the pieces rare, verified, and collectible. Filter the crypto art world's best selling works by artist name, creation type, and year of birth on OpenSea.
